organization.fullName: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

identificationModule.briefTitle: Patient-centered Outcomes After Permanent Female Sterilization Procedure(POPS Trial)
identificationModule.officialTitle: Patient-centered Outcomes After Permanent Female Sterilization Procedure: A Randomized Controlled Trial Comparing Three Surgical Routes

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

leadSponsor.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to compare and capture key elements of the patient experience, quality of recovery, preferences and satisfaction after laparoscopic salpingectomy done via 3 different routes.

keywords: vaginal natural orifice transluminal endoscopic surgery

interventions.name: Traditional laparoscopy
interventions.description: Utilizes three or four 5 mm ports for access and retrieval.

interventions.name: Single site laparoscopy
interventions.description: One port is placed via a 2 to 3 cm umbilical/fascia incision to accommodate the Gelpoint device, where several laparoscopic instruments are used. With this technique, there is a single incision, hidden in the umbilicus a

interventions.name: V-Notes surgery
interventions.description: One port placed trans-vaginally via a 2-3 cm vaginal incision with no abdominal scars

primaryOutcomes.measure: Quality of recovery after surgery as assessed by the Quality of Recovery (QOR-40 )questionnaire
primaryOutcomes.description: This questionnaire has 40 questions, score varies from 40 (poor)-200 (excellent) a higher number indicating a better outcome

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Cosmesis as assessed by the Body Image Questionnaire
secondaryOutcomes.description: This includes 5 questions and each is scored on a 4-point Likert scale from 1(no, not at all) to 4(yes, extremely) with a maximum score of 20 and higher score indicating a better body image

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Cosmesis as assessed by the Body Image Questionnaire
secondaryOutcomes.description: This includes 5 questions and each is scored on a 4-point Likert scale from 1(no, not at all) to 4(yes, extremely) with a maximum score of 20 and higher score indicating a better body image

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Cosmesis as assessed by the Body Image Questionnaire
secondaryOutcomes.description: This includes 5 questions and each is scored on a 4-point Likert scale from 1(no, not at all) to 4(yes, extremely) with a maximum score of 20 and higher score indicating a better body image

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in sexual function as assessed by the Short version of the Female Sexual Function Index (FSFI)
secondaryOutcomes.description: This has 9 items that address sexual dysfunctions. Each of these items are scored on a six-point scale ranging from 0 to 5, higher the score the better sexual function.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pain as assessed by the Resting Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Rating pain on a scale from 0 to 10, 0 is no pain and 10 is severe pain during a quiet breathing period (resting VAS)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pain as assessed by the Resting Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Rating pain on a scale from 0 to 10, 0 is no pain and 10 is severe pain during a quiet breathing period (resting VAS)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pain as assessed by the Resting Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Rating pain on a scale from 0 to 10, 0 is no pain and 10 is severe pain during a quiet breathing period (resting VAS)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pain as assessed by the Resting Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Rating pain on a scale from 0 to 10, 0 is no pain and 10 is severe pain during a quiet breathing period (resting VAS)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Pain as assessed by the Dynamic Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Rating pain on a scale from 0 to 10, 0 is no pain and 10 is severe pain after a voluntary cough (dynamic VAS)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Patient satisfaction as assessed by the satisfaction scale
secondaryOutcomes.description: Patients will rate their satisfaction on a 5 point Likert scale from 1(very unsatisfied) to 5(very satisfied)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Premenopausal women scheduled to undergo an elective sterilization surgery regardless of parity
* non-prolapsed uterus
* Patients should able to provide written consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* Women who have relative contra-indication to vaginal peritoneal access such as: history of rectal surgery, suspected recto-vaginal endometriosis based on clinical history and examination, suspected malignancy, pelvic inflammatory disease, active lower genital tract infection, virginity or pregnancy
* Postpartum (immediate) tubal sterilization
* Tubal sterilization during a cesarean section
